Text:
I managed to run your code like this (basing on [this answer](http://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/wpapps/en-us/c2cc57b1-ba1f-48fb-b285-d6cfbb8f393a/windows-phone-8-emulator-returns-microsofts-location-only?forum=wptools) and [MSDN howto](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsphone/develop/hh202933(v=vs.105).aspx)):

  - I've started the emulator, opened AdditionalTools -> Location and clicked somewhere on the Map (as my Location)

  ![enter image description here][1]

  - run Maps App - I see that shows the Location I've set, Close the Maps App
  - after that your App should point the right Location

As it's written at MSDN - it seems to be a bug which running Maps App fixes.
  [1]: http://i.stack.imgur.com/WbmS9.jpg

I've managed to run your code like this (basing on [this answer](http://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/wpapps/en-us/c2cc57b1-ba1f-48fb-b285-d6cfbb8f393a/windows-phone-8-emulator-returns-microsofts-location-only?forum=wptools) and [MSDN howto](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsphone/develop/hh202933(v=vs.105).aspx)):

  - I've started the emulator, opened AdditionalTools -> Location and clicked somewhere on the Map (as my Location)

 ![fixGeoLocation][1]

  - run Maps App - I see that shows the Location I've set, Close the Maps App
  - after that your App should point the right Location

As it's written at MSDN - it seems to be a bug which running Maps App fixes.
 


  [1]: http://i.stack.imgur.com/YGsmi.jpg
